lattice.Lattice¶

class pymls.lattice.Lattice(matrix: ndarray | None = None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Simple representation of a lattice

property G¶

Alias of self.metric_tensor.

property M¶

Alias of self.matrix.

property V¶

Alias of self.volume.

property a¶

Lattice scalar a.

property abc¶

Lattice vector magnitudes (a, b, c).

property al¶

Lattice scalar \(\alpha\).

angle(x1: ndarray, x2: ndarray, degrees=False)[source]¶

Angle between cartesian coordinates x1 and x2 taking vertex as origin.

Parameters:

  • x1 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates 1.

  • x2 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinates 2.

  • degrees (Bool, optional) – Return degrees or radians. The default is radians.

Returns:

\(\angle(x_1, O, x_2)\).

Return type:

Float

angle_between(x1: ndarray, x2: ndarray, x3: ndarray, degrees=False)[source]¶

Angle \(\angle(x_1, x_2, x_3)\) with vertex at \(x_2\).

Parameters:

  • x1 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinate 1.

  • x2 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinate 2.

  • x3 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinate 3.

  • degrees (Bool, optional) – Return degrees or radians. The default is False (radians).

Returns:

\(\angle(x_1,x_2,x_3) = cos^{-1}(x_{12} \cdot G \cdot x_{23} / (|x_{12}|\ |x_{23}|))\).

Return type:

Float

property angles¶

Lattice vector angles \((\alpha, \beta, \gamma)\).

property b¶

Lattice scalar ‘b’.

property be¶

Lattice scalar \(\beta\).

property c¶

Lattice scalar ‘c’.

returns new instance of self from self.M

dhkl(h, k, l)[source]¶

D-spacing for the corresponding Miller indices.

Parameters:

  • k (Int) – Miller indices.

  • l (Int) – Miller indices.

Returns:

Reciprocal lattice spacing.

Return type:

Float

classmethod from_metric(x: ndarray) → Lattice[source]¶

Constructor method for Lattice instance.

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}\vec{a}\cdot\vec{b} = a\ b\ cos(\theta)\\\theta = cos^{-1}\left(\frac{\vec{a}\cdot\vec{b}}{a b}\right)\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
Parameters:

x (np.ndarray) – Lattice metric tensor (G).

Returns:

Instance of Lattice.

Return type:

Lattice

classmethod from_scalar(x: tuple) → Lattice[source]¶

Constructor method for Lattice instance.

Parameters:

x (tuple) – Scalar lattice (a, b, c, alpha, beta, gamma).

Returns:

  • Lattice – Instance of Lattice.

  • Reference

  • ———

  • Julian (2014) Foundations of Crystallography, p.17 eqn. 1.6

property ga¶

Lattice scalar \(\gamma\).

property laue¶

Laue group (may be depricated for Lattice class).

length(v1: ndarray)[source]¶

Distance between points x1 and x2.

Parameters:

  • x1 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinate 1.

  • x2 (np.ndarray) – Cartesian coordinate 2.

Returns:

\(\sqrt{x_1 \cdot G \cdot x_2}\).

Return type:

Float

property matrix: ndarray¶

Vector basis of lattice, as in

\[ \begin{align}\begin{aligned}matrix = [\vec{x_1}, \vec{x_2}, \vec{x_3}]\\\begin{split} = \begin{bmatrix} ( x_{11} & x_{12} & x_{13} )\\ ( x_{21} & x_{22} & x_{23} )\\ ( x_{31} & x_{32} & x_{33} )\\ \end{bmatrix}\end{split}\end{aligned}\end{align} \]
property metric_tensor¶

Metric tensor of the crystal lattice.

\[G = M \cdot M^T\]
property reciprocal¶

Lattice instance from \(M^{-1}\).

NB private attribute set on instantiation.

property scalar: ndarray¶

Lattice scalars \((a, b, c, \alpha, \beta, \gamma)\).

transform(x: np.ndarray, sp.spatial.transform.Rotation) → Lattice[source]¶

Will probably deprecate sp.spatial.Rotation in favor of generalized Affine approach.

property volume¶

Lattice volume:

\[V = \sqrt{ det\ G }\]
